chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M Walden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lisa M Walden is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lisa M Walden was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 3 days sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation if revoked.
06/25/2018 PER HEARING COURT MODIFIES THE DL REVOCATION AND IID TO 24 MONTHS EACH.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Restitution (payable to Target) - PAID IN FULL.
Cash bail applied to blood draw fee and DNA surcharge - PAID IN FULL.  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Department.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Ignition interlock device installed for the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Case 14CM536 is dismissed and read in.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant to contact Probation no later than 09:00 a.m. on 07-08-2015.
Defendant has completed a Victim Impact Panel.

Cash bail applied to fine.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lisa M Walden in court with attorney Michael Hart.   
Case called along with:  14CF1001 & 14CM536

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:  
Total Prison:  4.5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  2 Years.
3 Days Credit.
STAYED

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

36 Months D/L REVOCATION
36 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Concurrent with:  Case 15CF377
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Restitution in the amount of $467.31 to be paid to Target in case (14CM536) - to be paid before costs/fines.
Defendant to contact Probation no later than 9:00 a.m. on 07/08/15.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be paid to the City of Waukesha Police Department);
FINE:  $1,582
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail to 15CF377 Fist then Restitution on this matter, then to Costs/Fines/Surcharges.
Balance to be paid Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
225 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
FORTHWITH - Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  Already Completed.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
